Actions.Name: Get Activity Strengths and Weaknesses
Actions.Description: This endpoint returns the average strengths and weaknesses for a company, team or user (depending on the level of granularity of the query) for a specific language or all languages

Actions.Name: Get Activity Top Performers
Actions.Description: This is used to retrieve list of top performing users.

Actions.Name: Assign Assessments
Actions.Description: This endpoint will assign the given assessment to the specified users/teams. Returns a list of users that were assigned to the assessment with their email, inviteUrl and status indicating whether invite email was sent.

Actions.Name: Get Assessment Attempts
Actions.Description: This endpoint returns a detailed report for all developers who have taken the Assessment with the given ID. The scope of the report may be filtered in a number of ways. You may filter results to a given developer by supplying their email address with the query. If a start date is provided, only attempts started or completed after (and including) this date are included. If an end date is provided, only challenges started or completed before this date are included. Providing both indicates a date range to filter on. This includes all the data in the summary report plus details on all the challenges that are a part of the assessment.

Actions.Name: Search Assessment
Actions.Description: This endpoint will return a list of Assessment objects which contain a range of datapoints related to assessments. This includes assessment IDs, which may be used in conjunction with the other assessments API endpoints. Results can be filtered based on status, name, supported language and difficulty.

Actions.Name: Search Assessment Attempts
Actions.Description: This endpoint returns a detailed report for all developers who have taken the Assessment with the given ID. The scope of the report may be filtered in a number of ways. You may filter results to given developer(s) by supplying their email address(es) with the query. If a status is provided, only assessment attempts with specified status are included. If team name(s) provided, only assessment attempts of users within those team(s) are included. If tags(s) is provided, only assessment attempts of users with those tag(s) are included. If a pass_status is provided, only assessment attempts with specified pass_status are included. This includes all the data in the summary report plus details on all the challenges that are a part of the assessment.

Actions.Name: Get Assessments
Actions.Description: This endpoint will return a list of Assessment objects which contain a range of datapoints related to assessments. This includes assessment IDs, which may be used in conjunction with the other assessments API endpoints.

Actions.Name: Get progress of all developers for the course
Actions.Description: This endpoint will return the progress of all developers for the specified course.

Actions.Name: Get course URL
Actions.Description: JSON containing course URL

Actions.Name: Get all courses
Actions.Description: This endpoint will return a list of Course objects which contain a range of datapoints related to courses. This includes course IDs, which may be used in conjunction with the other course API endpoints.

Actions.Name: Get Developer Activity
Actions.Description: This endpoint returns the detailed challenge log of all developers within the organisation, with challenge score, difficulty and challenge outcome of the developer.

Actions.Name: Get Developer Leaderboard
Actions.Description: This endpoint returns a list of all developers within the organisation, with their current stats as well as the change in stats over the report period (which may be 1, 7 or 30 days).

Actions.Name: Get Developer Progress
Actions.Description: This endpoint returns the training progress of all developers within the organisation, with current realm, level and quest progress.

Actions.Name: Search Developers Activity
Actions.Description: This endpoint returns the detailed challenge log of all developers within the organisation, with challenge score, difficulty and challenge outcome of the developer. This also lists the challenge log over the report period (which may be 1, 7 or 30 days) or a given date range. Results can be filtered based on developer emails, developer tags and team names.

Actions.Name: Search Developer Leaderboard
Actions.Description: This endpoint returns a list of all developers within the organisation, with their current stats. This also lists the change in stats over the report period (which may be 1, 7 or 30 days) or a given date range. Results can be filtered based on developer emails, developer tags and team names.

Actions.Name: Search course developers progress
Actions.Description: This endpoint returns the course progress of all developers within the organisation.

Actions.Name: Search Developers Progress
Actions.Description: This endpoint returns the training progress of all developers within the organisation, with current realm, level and quest progress. This also lists the change in developer progress over the report period (which may be 1, 7 or 30 days) or a given date range. Results can be filtered based on developer emails, developer tags and team names.

Actions.Name: Shows learning resources which have be completed, read or watched
Actions.Description: Learning description

Actions.Name: Get Resources
Actions.Description: Learning resources list

Actions.Name: Search Learning Progress
Actions.Description: Learning description Filters - users, teams and tags

Actions.Name: Create a team
Actions.Description: This is used to create a team.

Actions.Name: Delete team
Actions.Description: This is used to delete a team.

Actions.Name: Get team details
Actions.Description: This is used to get details of a team.

Actions.Name: Get Team Leaderboard
Actions.Description: This endpoint returns a list of all teams within the organisation, with their current stats as well as the change in stats over the report period (which may be 1, 7 or 30 days).

Actions.Name: Get Team Activity Most Engaged
Actions.Description: This endpoint returns the top 'N' most engaged teams.

Actions.Name: Get Teams
Actions.Description: This endpoint will return a list of Team objects which contain a range of datapoints related to teams. This includes team IDs, which may be used in conjunction with the other team API endpoints.

Actions.Name: Update team details
Actions.Description: This is used to update details of a team.

Actions.Name: Get time spent
Actions.Description: Time spent on the platform across Assessments, Learning, Tournaments and Training.

Actions.Name: Get Tournament Leaderboard
Actions.Description: This endpoint returns the leaderboard for a single tournament. This includes all levels, challenges and stages that the developer participated in, with detailed metrics of each.

Actions.Name: Search Tournament Leaderboard
Actions.Description: This endpoint returns the leaderboard for a single tournament. This includes all levels, challenges and stages that the developer participated in, with detailed metrics of each. This endpoint can also return the leaderboard over a report period (which may be 1, 7 or 30 days) or a given date range. Results can be filtered based on developer emails, developer tags and team names.

Actions.Name: Get Tournaments
Actions.Description: This endpoint returns a list of tournaments in the company.

Actions.Name: Create a user
Actions.Description: Creates a User.

Actions.Name: Delete User
Actions.Description: Deletes the user referenced by the given ID.

Actions.Name: Get User
Actions.Description: This is used to retrieve a single user record. The response may be shaped by passing in a fields query parameter listing the attribute names to return.

Actions.Name: Get Users Activity Most Engaged
Actions.Description: This endpoint returns the top 'N' most engaged users.

Actions.Name: Search Users
Actions.Description:
This is used to retrieve all user records. The response may be shaped by passing in a fields query parameter listing the
attribute names to return. Filter is achieved by passing the filter criteria through the body.

Actions.Name: Get Users
Actions.Description:
This is used to retrieve all user records. The response may be shaped by passing in a fields query parameter listing the
attribute names to return.

Actions.Name: Update User
Actions.Description: Updates a user with the given data. Tags will be replaced.
